headline: Trump Bought Bonds Worth $51 Million for His Personal Investments
summary: The new White House disclosure posted Thursday shows Trump’s buys included bonds from Netflix Inc., CoreWeave Inc., General Motors Co., Boeing Co., Occidental Petroleum Corp. and United Rentals Inc. He also purchased municipal bonds from American cities and local school districts, utilities and hospitals.  The report, which all federal elected officials and appointees who trade must submit, doesn’t specify exact amounts or prices, since only broad ranges of transactions involving stocks, bonds, commodity futures and other securities are required.

raw.headline: Trump Bought Bonds Worth $51 Million for His Personal Investments
raw.summary: The new White House disclosure posted Thursday shows Trump’s buys included bonds from Netflix Inc., CoreWeave Inc., General Motors Co., Boeing Co., Occidental Petroleum Corp. and United Rentals Inc. He also purchased municipal bonds from American cities and local school districts, utilities and hospitals.  The report, which all federal elected officials and appointees who trade must submit, doesn’t specify exact amounts or prices, since only broad ranges of transactions involving stocks, bonds, commodity futures and other securities are required.

headline: China's Tesla-Crushing EV Company Creeps Into U.S. Market
summary: BYD overtook Tesla to become the world's leading EV company. Now, the possibility of breaking into the American car market is closer than ever, as President Donald Trump opens the door for Chinese car factories in the U.S.

headline: Ford CEO explains what the US auto industry got wrong about EVs
summary: US automaker Ford (F) looks to pivot from its EV strategy in 2026 in a bid to compete with Chinese competitors as electric vehicle demand wanes in the US. The car company recently announced its hybrid-centric approach moving forward while cancelling its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line. Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to discuss the auto manufacturer's renewed outlook on EVs and electrification trends. Watch Yahoo Finance's full interview with Ford CEO Jim Farley by clicking here. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Ford CEO: US trade deal with Mexico, Canada 'critical for our country'
summary: Ford (F) plans to pivot on its EV strategy in 2026 to better compete with Chinese automakers, including a more focused approach to hybrid vehicles as the US company cancels its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line. Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to address a variety of topics, including the "critical" points of the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the Big Three automaker's refreshed perspective on electrification trends and EV demand, the new vehicles announced at the event, and the company's partnership with Formula One racing teams. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

raw.summary: Ford (F) plans to pivot on its EV strategy in 2026 to better compete with Chinese automakers, including a more focused approach to hybrid vehicles as the US company cancels its F-150 Lightning electric pickup line. Ford CEO Jim Farley sits down Yahoo Finance Senior Autos Reporter Pras Subramanian from the 2026 Detroit Autos Show to address a variety of topics, including the "critical" points of the United States–Mexico–Canada Agreement (USMCA), the Big Three automaker's refreshed perspective on electrification trends and EV demand, the new vehicles announced at the event, and the company's partnership with Formula One racing teams. headline: White House Always Answers the Phone, Ford CEO Says
summary: Ford Motor Co. Chief Executive Officer Jim Farley says the Trump administration will "always answer the phone" and has been great to work with, but he says there is still a long list of issues to work through. He speaks to Bloomberg's Matt Miller.
